title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Circular - Instructions to Assistant Superintendents, December 14, 1865
summary: How circulates his instructions to his agents in the field regarding their duties for the Bureau. The instructions urge vigilance and efficiency in the execution of their responsibilities, and also communicates an optimistic and paternalistic attitude toward free blacks.
keywords: Administration/Bureaucracy, Employment/Labor, Slavery, American Civil War
